Package Pages

Class CruiseAppUtilities

java.lang.Object
Pages.CruiseAppUtilities
public class CruiseAppUtilities extends Object
This CruiseAppUtilities in this Pages package provides utility methods and constants.

This class serves as a central repository for common utility methods and constants used throughout the application. It includes methods for creating styled UI components, handling user authentication, updating UI elements based on password validation, and managing navigation between different panels in the application's interface.

Key features include:

  • Methods for creating styled labels and buttons.
  • A centralized authentication mechanism that handles user login and transitions to appropriate user-specific panels.
  • Dynamic password requirement display for real-time feedback during account creation or password changes.
  • Predefined criteria for password validation used throughout the application for consistency.

The class also maintains references to current user objects (such as currentGuest, currentAgent, etc.) and global UI-related constants like colors and fonts.

    • requirements

      public static List<String> requirements
      Predefined password requirements for validation in the application.

      This static List outlines the initial criteria for password validation. The password requirements are as follows:

      1. "At least 8 characters" - Ensuring the password is a minimum of 8 characters long.
      2. "At least one digit" - Requiring the inclusion of at least one numerical digit.
      3. "At least one letter" - Mandating the presence of at least one alphabetic letter.
      4. "At least one special character" - Necessitating at least one specified special character.

  • Method Details

    • createStyledLabel

      public static JLabel createStyledLabel(String text, Font font)
      Constructs a JLabel with the specified text and font, and sets a predefined background color.

      This method creates a JLabel, sets its text to the provided value, applies the specified Font, and configures its background color to the BACKGROUND_COLOR. Additionally, the label is set to opaque to ensure the background color is visible.

      Parameters:
      text - the text to be displayed on the label
      font - the Font to be applied to the label's text
      Returns:
      a JLabel instance styled with the given text, font, and background color

    • createStyledButton

      public static JButton createStyledButton(String text, Font font, Color color)
      Constructs a JButton with specified text, font, and background color.

      This method creates a JButton, sets its text to the provided value, applies the specified Font, and sets the background to the given Color.

      Parameters:
      text - the text to be displayed on the button
      font - the Font to be used for the button's text
      color - the Color for the button's background
      Returns:
      a JButton styled with the specified text, font, and background color

    • handleLogin

      public static void handleLogin(JTextField usernameField, JPasswordField passwordField, JFrame frame)
      Authenticates a user and navigates to their respective panel based on their role.

      This method authenticates a user using the Person.login method by retrieving text from the specified username and password fields. Upon successful authentication, it navigates to the appropriate user panel (Guest, Travel Agent, Admin, Manager) and displays a success message. If the credentials are invalid, an error message is displayed.

      The user's role is determined during the login process, which sets the corresponding current user object (e.g., currentGuest, currentAgent, currentAdmin, currentManager). The method then adds the relevant panel to the frame and switches the view accordingly.

      After login processing, the username and password fields are cleared.

      Parameters:
      usernameField - the JTextField containing the username
      passwordField - the JPasswordField containing the password
      frame - the JFrame to which user-specific panels are added and where the view is switched

    • addAdminPanelToFrame

      public static void addAdminPanelToFrame(JFrame frame)
      Adds the Admin panel to the specified JFrame.

      This method creates the Admin panel by invoking AdminAccountPage.createAdminTabbedPane. The resulting JTabbedPane, designated for administrative tasks, is then added to the provided JFrame with the identifier "Admin View". After adding the panel, the frame is refreshed to display the new view.

      Parameters:
      frame - the JFrame to which the Admin panel is added

    • addGuestPanelToFrame

      public static void addGuestPanelToFrame(JFrame frame)
      Adds the Guest panel to the specified JFrame.

      This method creates the Guest panel by invoking GuestAccountPage.createGuestViewTabbedPane. The resulting JTabbedPane, designated for guest tasks, is then added to the provided JFrame with the identifier "Guest View". After adding the panel, the frame is refreshed to display the new view.

      Parameters:
      frame - the JFrame to which the Guest panel is added

    • addAgentPanelToFrame

      public static void addAgentPanelToFrame(JFrame frame)
      Integrates the Travel Agent panel into the specified JFrame.

      This method creates the Travel Agent panel by invoking TravelAgentAccountPage.createTravelAgentViewTabbedPane. The resulting JTabbedPane, designated for agent tasks, is then added to the provided JFrame with the identifier "Agent View". After adding the panel, the frame is refreshed to display the new view.

      Parameters:
      frame - the JFrame to which the Travel Agent panel is added

    • addManagerPanelToFrame

      public static void addManagerPanelToFrame(JFrame frame)
      Adds the Manager panel to the specified JFrame.

      This method creates the Manager panel by invoking ManagerAccountPage.createManagerViewPanel. The resulting JPanel, designated for manager tasks, is then added to the provided JFrame with the identifier "Manager View". After adding the panel, the frame is refreshed to display the new view.

      Parameters:
      frame - the JFrame to which the Manager panel is added

    • switchToPanel

      public static void switchToPanel(JFrame frame, String panelName)
      Switches to a specified panel in the given JFrame, identified by its name.

      This method performs a view transition within a JFrame that uses a CardLayout. It casts the layout manager of the frame's content pane to CardLayout and then employs the show method to display the panel identified by the provided panelName.

      Parameters:
      frame - the JFrame that contains the panels to be switched
      panelName - the name identifier of the panel to be displayed, as defined when added to the frame

    • validatePassword

      public static String validatePassword(String password)
      Validates a password against predefined criteria.

      This method checks the provided password to ensure it meets the following criteria:

      1. Length: The password must be at least 8 characters long.
      2. Digit Inclusion: The password must include at least one digit.
      3. Letter Inclusion: The password must contain at least one letter.
      4. Special Character Inclusion: The password must have at least one special character from the set.

      If the password does not meet any of these criteria, an appropriate error message is returned. If it meets all criteria, an empty string is returned, indicating the password is valid.

      Parameters:
      password - the password string to validate
      Returns:
      an error message if the password fails validation, or an empty string if it passes
